snippet.title: Shifting, Stretching and Reflecting Parent Function Graphs
snippet.description:
Learn how to recognize shifts, vertical and horizontal stretches and reflections as they affect parent functions in this free math video tutorial by Mario's Math Tutoring.

0:22 Diagrams of 6 Basic Parent Functions
1:07 Looking at a Horizontal Shift of the Square Root Function
1:53 Looking at a Horizontal Shift of the Absolute Value Function
2:15 Vertical Stretch of the Reciprocal Function
2:57 A General Way to Analyze Shifts, Stretches and Reflections
3:44 Example of Transforming a Cubic Function
4:00 A Shortcut for Graphing by Shifting the Origin or Starting Point
4:50 A Reflection of the Step Function
5:29 A Horizontal Compression of the Quadratic Function
6:23 More Challenging Example 
8:18 A Simpler Way to Graph Taking the Translation into Account First
9:37 A Summary of the Transformations
10:26 A Reflection Over the x-axis

Related Videos:

Graphing Step Functions
https://youtu.be/tHwpj9b4zZo

Graphing Square Root & Cube Root Functions
https://youtu.be/PPVW33Qnv4U

Graphing Parabolas in Vertex Form
https://youtu.be/TxPDQfWeAUg
